pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, June 5, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, June 5, 2017:

Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario 

10:45 a.m. The Prime Minister and the Minister for Environment and Climate Change, Catherine McKenna, will paddle the Niagara River to celebrate World Environment Day. Remarks will follow.

Queen’s Royal Park
16 Front Street
Niagara-on-the-Lake, Ontario

Notes for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity of paddle
  • Open coverage for remarks
  • Media should arrive no later than 10:15 a.m.

Ottawa, Ontario 

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend Question Period.

3:20 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the Welcoming Ceremony for the President of Chile, Michelle Bachelet.

Rotunda, Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity

3:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a bilateral meeting with the President of Chile.

Prime Minister’s Office, Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity at beginning of the meeting

4:25 p.m. The Prime Minister and the President of Chile will participate in a Signing Ceremony.

Hall of Honour, Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity

4:35 p.m. The Prime Minister and the President of Chile will hold a joint media availability.

Reading Room, Centre Block
Parliament Hill

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

7:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will host a working dinner for the President of Chile.

7 Rideau Gate
Ottawa, Ontario

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity for arrival


Media appearance

An interview with the Prime Minister for LIVE with Kelly and Ryan will air on ABC and CTV at 9:15 a.m.
